content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 21 Jun 2019Someone told me if i purchase the stock shares before ex dividend date but after announcement of dividend per share, i will not be entitled to the dividend. Is that true?4 answersAnswerBump1

PatLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 22 Jun 2019Nope, as long as it is before the ex-div date, you will receive it. If you purchase on or after the ex-div date, that div issue goes to the seller.0 comments4

Yinghua LiuLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 22 Jun 2019You will get the dividend if you purchase the stock before the ex dividend date. Also, if u sold off the stock before ex dividend date, you will not be entitled to the dividend.0 comments1

Gavin TanLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 22 Jun 2019Nope, you just need to buy before the XD date (ex-dividend date). If you sell before the XD date, you will not be entitled to the dividends, you have to hold onto the stock until after the ex-dividend date!0 comments0
Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 22 Jun 2019Buy before and do not sell before XD ex dividend, and you will get dividend0 comments0
